intro: Nototriche pichinchensis, commonly known as the Pichincha nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Nototriche pichinchensis is often found in rocky or disturbed soils at higher elevations.
